html: (2 Nephi 27:31)."The terrible one is brought to nought." Isaiah appears to return to an earlier pronouncement against the wicked, whose works will ultimately fail ("brought to nought"). (See commentary on 29:5.) The "terrible one" could also refer to the devil himself, who will lose his power at the commencement of the Millennium and will ultimately be defeated during the "little season" at the end of this period of peace.
